org.rcsb.mbt.model.attributes
Class InterpolatedColorMap

java.lang.Object
  org.rcsb.mbt.model.attributes.InterpolatedColorMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
IColorMap
public class InterpolatedColorMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements IColorMap

This class implements the ColorMap interface by generating a linear interpolated color from a list of user-defined color knots.

Each knot consists of a float[4] tuple where:
float[0] is the knot location (0.0 to 1.0)
float[1] is the knot red value (0.0 to 1.0)
float[2] is the knot green value (0.0 to 1.0)
float[3] is the knot blue value (0.0 to 1.0)

A knot set consists of a float[n][4] tuple.

Author:
John L. Moreland
See Also:
IColorMap

getColor

public void getColor(float value,
                     float[] color)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Given a normalized float (0.0-1.0) value, the getColor method returns an interpolated RGB color value based upon the user-defined color knots. Values may be clamped.
